meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of neocolonialism.
meanings.sent1: The neocolonial policies of the powerful nations exploit the resources of weaker countries.
meanings.sent2: The neocolonial influence of the foreign corporation was evident in the local economy.
meanings.sent3: The neocolonial fashion trend of wearing traditional clothing with a modern twist became popular.
meanings.sent4: The neocolonial grip of the multinational company tightened around the local businesses.
meanings.sent5: The neocolonial practices of the empire left a lasting impact on the region.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a policy of maintaining political or economic control over other countries or territories without direct control.
meanings.sent1: The neocolonial approach of influencing governments from afar raised concerns about sovereignty.
meanings.sent2: The neocolonial strategy of economic dominance without direct rule sparked debates among policymakers.
meanings.sent3: The neocolonial idea of controlling markets without physical presence seemed like a clever loophole.
meanings.sent4: The neocolonial shadow loomed over the region, shaping its political landscape.
meanings.sent5: The neocolonial grip on trade routes restricted the development of local industries.
